title: By what number must the given number be multiplied to decrease the number by 20%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Simple math I suppose. Let us take a number say Y. 20 % of Y = 0.2 Y A decrease of 20% in Y means the new number will be = Y - 0.2 Y = 0.8 Y But 0.8 Y must be obtained by multiplying a number to Y. let's take the number to be multiplied as M. We have M x Y = 0.8 Y Therefore M = 0.8 = 4/5. General result: The general formula for finding the number to be multiplied to decrease another number by X % = (1-X/100).

Let xx be any number, and yy be the multiplier which will reduce x by 2020%. ⟹x⋅y=x−(20⟹x⋅y=x−(20% of xx) ⟹x⋅y=x−20100⋅x⟹x⋅y=x−20100⋅x ⟹x⋅y=(80100)⋅x⟹x⋅y=(80100)⋅x Now, since 00 reduced by any number is also 00 only, so we can take x≠0x≠0 for the above equation. Hence we have y=80100y=80100 Or, y=0.8y=0.8 Hope that helps :)
